title: CPS: Akerman, Ancel, Engler Bills, 2023 - Current

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023 through current:

1) Copies of all invoices from the Akerman LLP;
2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Akerman LLP. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Akerman LLP, including any modifications or changes.

4) Copies of all invoices from the Ancel Glick PC;
5) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Ancel Glick PC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
6) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Ancel Glick PC, including any modifications or changes.

7) Copies of all invoices from the Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLC;
8) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLCC. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.
9) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Engler Callaway Baasten & Sraga LLC, including any modifications or changes.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

To Whom It May Concern:

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a recent article https://www.kuow.org/stories/who-was-the-anonymous-donor-behind-seattle-s-denny-blaine-nude-beach-we-found-out, it was mentioned that the mayor received text messages related to city business on his personal cell phone.

Please provide all text conversations from the mayor's personal cell phone relating to government business between June 1, 2023 and the date this request was received, including metadata such as the sender, the time a message was sent, as well as any images and attachments, as allowed under Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Clarification of your FOIA request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Julieta Cardenas

The USDA Office of Information Affairs (OIA) has received the attached FOIA request you submitted online. As a preliminary matter, your request is overly broad and will need refining in order to perform a search.

We do not have the ability to perform a broad, agency-wide search of all email accounts under the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture, including all staff. We would like to narrow the request to specific record custodians, if possible.  Would you be amenable to limiting your request to a search of specific named custodians accounts under the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture? With that narrowing, we would be able to proceed with processing of your request.

If you have any questions or would like to discuss narrowing your request, please feel free to reach out by email or at the number below.

Please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you,



[cid:image001.png@01DAA864.614AD0E0]
Olga Colacicco
FOIA Analyst Contractor
Freedom of Information Act Division
Office of Information Affairs
U.S. Department of Agriculture
1400 Independence Ave., SW
Washington, DC  20250
☎   (202) 690-5037
✉   olga.colacicco@usda.gov<mailto:roman.vayner@usda.gov>

title: Passport Application of Elsie B. Knodel

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Passport Application of Elsie B. Knodel
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, I am writing to request access to the passport application and related records of my 3rd great aunt, Elsie B. Knodel. The details are as follows:

Full Name: Elsie B. Knodel
Date of Birth: November 21, 1894
Date of Death: June 17, 1992
Passport Number: B34 1306

Please provide copies of the application and any associated documents. If these records are archived, I would appreciate any guidance or instructions on how to access them.

If there are any fees for searching, copying, or processing this request, please inform me of the cost before proceeding. 

If all or part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemptions that apply and inform me of the appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. If you require any further information or clarification, please feel free to reply.

Sincerely,

Jonah

title: Ohio IPHIS_EDRS Birth and Death Index

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio IPHIS_EDRS Birth and Death Index
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Public Records Act, Ohio Revised Code § 149.43, I am writing to request access to and a copy of the birth and death index from 1908 to the present day. Specifically, I am interested in obtaining a copy of the database from your Integrated Perinatal Health Information System and the Electronic Death Registration System (IPHIS-EDRS).

As stated in Ohio Revised Code § 149.43(B)(1), “all public records responsive to the request shall be promptly prepared and made available for inspection to any person at all reasonable times during regular business hours.” Moreover, the Ohio Revised Code defines public records broadly to include any document, device, or item, regardless of physical form or characteristic, created or received by or coming under the jurisdiction of any public office that documents the organization, functions, policies, decisions, procedures, operations, or other activities of the office.

Please inform me of any costs associated with fulfilling this request. I am willing to pay any reasonable fees for the processing of this request. If the cost exceeds $50, please contact me with an estimate before proceeding. However, if it is feasible, I would appreciate a fee waiver as this request is for the interest of the public and non-commercial educational purposes.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including the legal authority upon which the denial is based, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 149.43(B)(3).

I appreciate your time and attention to this matter and look forward to your prompt response. Should you have any questions or require further clarification regarding my request, please do not hesitate to reply.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Jonah

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c. 66, §10, for public records in the custody of your organization. The Center for Public Interest Advocacy and Collaboration is an educational, research and advocacy organization at Northeastern University School of Law. We produce publicly available interdisciplinary research and data analysis on important social issues.

We request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

             1. Cross tabulated counts of 51A reports filed against children, ages 3-18 in school years 2018- 
                   2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
                               a. School
                               b. Category of reporter (mandated or non-mandated)
                               c. Age of the child
                               d. Race of the child
                               e. Ethnicity of the child
                               f. Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child
                               g. Disability status of the child
                               h. Type of abuse or neglect alleged
             2. Intersectional counts of 51A reports filed against parents in school years 2018-2019, 2019- 
                2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
                               a. School of the child
                               b. Race of the parent
                               c. Ethnicity of the parent
                               d. Type of abuse or neglect alleged

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). If you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law
connor.mak@northeastern.edu
(508) 340-1740

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor

title: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any agency documents related to the American author John Simmons Barth and his novel "Sabbatical: A Love Story" published in 1982. Barth (born: May 27th, 1980 - died: April 2nd, 2024) published a novel called "Sabbatical: A Love Story" that was inspired by the death of agency employee John Paisley. 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2024/04/02/john-barth-author-dead-obituary/

Of particular interest is any agency correspondence (either to or from) the following agency officials that mention John Barth and "Sabbatical: A Love Story" or allude to the book publicizing the John Paisley episode:

William J. Casey 
Bobby Ray Inman
Frank Carlucci
John M. McMahon
Robert Gates

In addition, conduct a search of correspondence (either to or from) an agency public affairs or media representative that discussed John Barth or his writings. Please also conduct a search of any agency collection of news reports regarding John Barth and his writings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: John Barth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to the American author John Simmons Barth (May 27th, 1930 to April 2nd, 2024). Barth's recent death was widely reported in the mainstream media, with The Washington Post publishing a detailing obituary. Barth was a long time resident of the state of Maryland. The bureau might have maintained a file on Barth due to his novel "Sabbatical: A Romance" published in 1982. 

This request is for any and all records about my the American author John Simmons Barth from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Barth held by the Baltimore Field Office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to John Simmons Barth.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to John Simmons Barth. 

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to John Simmons Barth. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: CFTC: ChatGPT Chat Histories and Guidance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CFTC: ChatGPT Chat Histories and Guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any CFTC produced policies, memos, emails, or alerts regarding employee use of ChatGPT.
2. Any CFTC produced policies, memos, emails, or alerts regarding how ChatGPT either impacts or might impact CFTC's mission.
3. Chat histories of any all ChatGPT sessions conducted on Commodity Futures Trading Commission controlled devices between November 30th, 2022 and May 16th, 2024

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – District Public Records Request Responses 2019-2024
communications.communication:
KENT SCHOOL DISTRICT – District Public Records Request Responses 2019-2024

Via email: PublicRecords@Kent.k12.wa.us

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. A complete copy of any and all Public Records Requests received by the District in which the District did not provide a response to the requestor within 5 days as required by Washington State Law (RCW 42.56.520 - Prompt responses required.)

2. A complete copy of any and all Public Records Requests received by the District in which the District has received three (3) or more email requests for information from the requestor, however as of the date of this public records request (05-16-2024), the District has not provided a reply email or response to the requestor.

3. A complete copy of of any and all Public Records Requests received by the District in which the District DID NOT PROVIDE an installment of records to the requestor on or before the production date the District previously communicated to the requestor.

4. A complete copy of any and all Public Records Requests received by the District in which the District DID NOT RESPOND to an emailed request for information from the requestor within (7) days.

The date range for this public records request is 2019 – Present (May 16, 2024).

Include with the copies of these responsive public records requests, complete copies of all communications and emails your District has had with the public records requestor(s).

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS
RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS
Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation or NEXT-REQUEST.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, or NEXT-REQUEST.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES
In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

1. Name: Ramiro Garcia, Date of birth: 07-12-1966, Date of death: 07-11-2006
2. Name: James Wells, Date of birth: 01-12-1964, Date of death: 08-15-2007

14. Name: Emilio Villa, Date of birth: 07-30-1987, Date of death: 09-30-2020
15. Name: Trevor Seever, Date of birth: 04-21-1991, Date of death: 12-29-2020

17. Name: Marvin Hernandez, Date of birth: 01-10-1977, Date of death: 06-01-2021
18. Name: Kim Huckaby, Date of birth: 02-15-1964, Date of death: 11-01-2021

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at dillon@muckrock.com, or by phone at (267) 314-7952.

Thank you.

Best,
Dillon Bergin
